      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Signals whether the code is ready to be read. To avoid race conditions, this call should be made within a synchronized statement on this object, followed by a call to read within the synchronized statement: 
         PushButtonCodeInterpreter obj = ...;
 String code = null;
 
 synchronized(obj) {
   if(obj.isReady())
     code = read();
 }

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
                      throws CodeNotReadyException
        If the code is ready for consumption, returns the code as a string. Otherwise, it throws an exception. In either case, the state is reset to START.
        Throws:
        CodeNotReadyException
